summary: Email chain from August 2019 between Katherine Rodi of the NYC Department of Education and an FBI contact discussing a potential connection between a substitute teacher named Hoffer Kaback and the Jeffrey Epstein case, prompted by a press article about a former student from Talent Unlimited High School who claimed recruitment for Epstein.

persons.name: Katherine Rodi
persons.role: Executive Director, Office of Employee Relations, NYC Department of Education
persons.context: Author of the email raising concerns about substitute teacher Hoffer Kaback's potential connection to the Epstein case after a press article about a former student from Talent Unlimited High School.

persons.name: Hoffer Kaback
persons.context: Subject of the email inquiry; a substitute teacher in NYC DOE schools since 2005 with a 'weird' personal history and connections to circles not typical for a substitute, prompting suspicion of a possible link to Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; the email inquiry is about whether the substitute teacher Hoffer Kaback is connected to Epstein, following a press article about a former student recruited for Epstein.

connections.description: Email inquiry raises suspicion of a potential connection, as Kaback's 'weird' personal history and circles, combined with a press article about a former student recruited for Epstein, prompted investigation.
Email correspondence between Rodi and an FBI contact discussing the potential link between Hoffer Kaback and the Epstein case.

events.title: Press article about Epstein recruitment at Talent Unlimited HS
events.description: A press article was published about a former student from Talent Unlimited High School who claimed she was recruited for Jeffrey Epstein near the school.

events.title: Initial email inquiry about Hoffer Kaback
events.description: Katherine Rodi sent an initial email to an FBI contact asking if the name Hoffer Kaback was on the radar in relation to the Jeffrey Epstein case.

keyFacts: A press article on August 15, 2019, reported a former student from Talent Unlimited High School claimed she was recruited for Jeffrey Epstein near the school.

NYC DOE official Katherine Rodi raised concerns about substitute teacher Hoffer Kaback, who had been in DOE schools since 2005 but had a 'weird' personal history and moved in circles not typical for a substitute.
The FBI responded that the Epstein case was theirs and the name Hoffer Kaback was not familiar, but asked if there was something they should know.
The DOE was pulling Kaback's full service history to check if he was in other schools, indicating an internal investigation into potential connections to Epstein.
